sentences.english: Has the purple devoted to encourage and comfort can only temporarily soothe her injured heart.
sentences.chinese: 曾紫陌的鼓励和安慰也只能暂时稍稍安抚她受伤的心。

sentences.english: If your using the continental grip, your toss will be slightly over the left shoulder if your right handed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用大陆式握拍，你的抛球应该稍稍过左肩。

sentences.english: Cradle it with your left hand and apply slight pressure.
sentences.chinese: 用左手抱住右上臂并对其稍稍加压。

sentences.english: You can use a slightly water-dampened cloth to clean the screen.
sentences.chinese: 可用稍稍蘸水的布来清洁屏幕。

sentences.english: The rate cuts will soothe a little bit of jangled nerves at this time.
sentences.chinese: 这时降息可以稍稍平息人们杂乱的神经。

sentences.english: Grab some sandpaper after the glue has dried, and wear down the edge on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 胶水干后准备一些砂纸，把封面的边缘稍稍打磨光滑。

sentences.english: One of them is the technique you saw me do with my left hand where I wiggled it a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 其中一种就是我稍稍摆动我摁弦的左手，这种叫颤音。

sentences.english: We are experiencing a slight delay becase of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 因为天气的关系，我们会稍稍耽搁一下。

sentences.english: Jesse veered slightly to his left, moving nearer to the old well.
sentences.chinese: 杰希稍稍向左转，走近了那个废井。

sentences.english: My fortunes have improved a bit since then.
sentences.chinese: 那以后我的运气稍稍好了一点。
玛丽稍稍涂了一点脂粉。

sentences.english: The NW edge of the subtropical ridge retreated a bit last night.
sentences.chinese: 影响浣熊的副热带高压脊西北沿于昨晚稍稍东退。

sentences.english: I returned to Aunt Emily slightly oiled.
sentences.chinese: 我稍稍有点醉意，回到艾米莉姨妈家。
他稍稍一瞥，景物尽收眼底。

sentences.english: sex, sex positions, relationships. men, dating a women in puppet strings Stand facing a wall, as if you’re about to be strip-searched, placing both hands slightly above your head.
sentences.chinese: 面墙而站立，就像是要脱衣搜身，双手稍稍靠在头上。

sentences.english: Weight on the left foot with the feet slightly open.
sentences.chinese: 重心保持在左脚，双脚沿目标线稍稍打开。

definition: to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
